content.rendered:
Highlights of Botswana Safari

We offer you a luxury, all-inclusive Africa safari to three of the top destinations in Botswana, the Chobe National Park, Savute and the Okavango Delta. This safari includes effortless travelling by air, incredibly scenic destinations and unrivalled game viewing in truly remote and unspoiled wilderness areas.

Safari & Tour Overview

10 Days

Experience one of the best tourism offerings in Southern Africa during this 10 Day Luxury Botswana Safari with Jewel of Africa Safaris.

This safari combines three of the top destinations in this beautiful country, including the Chobe River, Chobe National Park (including its Savute region) and the Okavango Delta. This all-inclusive safari offers you luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality, effortless travelling and incredibly scenic destinations combined with unrivalled land-and water-based game viewing in some of the most wild and unspoiled wilderness areas in Africa.

*This safari can be customized according to your needs and preferences.

 

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 10 Days 9 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Chobe National Park, Botswana
  • Savute region, Chobe, Botswana
  • Okavango Delta, Botswana

Included

  • All Transfers
  • Charter Flights
  • Conservation Fees
  • Drinks
  • Laundry
  • Local Flights
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Safari Activities

 

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  • This is the best Botswana safari circuit
  • A luxury, all-inclusive safari
  • No fuss, hassle-free travel between destinations by charter flights
  • Daily game drives and boat cruises in unspoiled wilderness areas
  • Mokoro safaris and bush walks in the Delta
  • Unrivalled elephant viewing in Chobe
  • Top predator sightings in the Savute
  • Excellent animal and bird sightings in the Delta

 

Map & Destinations

Chobe National Park, Botswana
Savute region, Chobe, Botswana
Okavango Delta, Botswana

Chobe National Park

Chobe National Park, one of the largest Parks in Botswana is situated in north-east Botswana on the banks of the Chobe River. Due to Chobe National Park’s location close to some of the Africa’s most visited natural attractions, this is an ideal safari destination. The Park is biologically diverse and boasts with the highest concentration of elephants in the world. The wildlife and scenery can be enjoyed during game drives, bush walks and boat cruises which are on offer at all lodges and hotels.

Savute Region

The Savute is an area in Chobe National Park which borders the Okavango Delta to the west and Chobe National Park to the east and is one of Africa's best-known big game areas. Savute is famous for its predators, especially its resident lion and spotted hyena populations. The game-viewing can be exceptional, and the wide variety of activities make this an area not to be missed.

Okavango Delta

A maze of sparkling lagoons, meandering channels and overgrown islands teeming with wildlife, Botswana’s Okavango Delta lies like a sparkling jewel at the heart of the Kalahari Desert. Known as “the river that never finds the sea”, crystal clear channels spread over the thirst lands of the Kalahari with their papyrus-fringed banks and fertile floating islands. Adapted for a life in and out of water, the elegant red lechwe and shy sitatunga antelope are found in this watery wilderness. Lion, cheetah, leopard and African wild dog share the floodplains with large herds of elephant and buffalo.

Day to Day Itinerary

Day 1 :
Arrival in Chobe

On arrival in South Africa, board a flight from OR Tambo International Airport, Johannesburg to Kasane Airport, Botswana.

On arrival you will be met by our experienced ground crew and transferred to Chobe Game Lodge, the only lodge situated within the Chobe National Park.

Chobe National Park, one of the largest Parks in Botswana is situated in north-east Botswana on the banks of the Chobe River. The Park is biologically diverse and boasts with the highest concentration of elephants in the world.

On arrival, check in, relax and settle in the lodge. Lunch can be enjoyed on arrival, with your first afternoon safari activity (game drive) departing after 3PM.

Day 2 :
Explore Chobe

Chobe Game Lodge offers a choice of land or water-based activities and the most complete game experience in the Chobe National Park.

Early-morning and late-afternoon game drives are conducted by our expert guides in open-sided 4x4 vehicles. Meanwhile, riverside game viewing may be done from small and highly manoeuvrable boats, perfect for morning or sunset cruises.

Chobe's diverse wildlife roams in abundance – it is, for instance, home to the largest concentration of elephant in Africa. During the dry season these large herds, as well as vast herds of buffalo, congregate on the fertile flood plains along the Chobe River to drink, bathe and play. There are frequent sightings of lion, African wild dog, puku, red lechwe, sable, giraffe and roan antelope.

Daily itinerary

05:00 Early morning wake-up call.
05:30 Light breakfast
06:00 Leave for morning activity, (approximately 3 – 4 hours).
09:30 Breakfast is served in the dining area.
11:00 Optional mid-morning Chobe River safari.
12:30 Lunch is served in the dining area.
Siesta time - Relax and enjoy the lodge facilities and surroundings.
15:00 Afternoon tea
15:30 Depart for afternoon activity (approximately 3 hours).
19:00 Arrive back at the lodge.
19:30 Dinner is served in the dining area.

Day 3 :
Last day in Chobe

Enjoy your last day in the Chobe National Park. You can enjoy a morning and afternoon game drive or boat cruise or decide to stay at the lodge and relax and enjoy the beautiful views from your room.

Chobe Game Lodge is designed as a haven of peace and privacy – where relaxation is effortless, and you can enjoy your own space. With six comfortably furnished viewing decks, a riverside boma, two bars, six different lounges and four dining locations, a comfy chair or lounger is never far away, each with a different perspective on the wilderness that surrounds the lodge. A large swimming pool provides welcome relief during hot afternoons and there is always a waiter on hand to bring you refreshments from the bar.

Guests wishing to pamper themselves are welcome to book one of the delightful treatments from the in-house beautician or hit the gym for some exercise between the usual Lodge activities.

Day 4 :
From Chobe to Savute

After your last morning safari activity and breakfast, check out and enjoy a short transfer to Kasane Airport. From here you will be transferred by charter flight to the Savute Safari Lodge situated in the Savute Region of Chobe National Park.

Savute is famous for the Savute Marsh and its predators, especially its resident lion and spotted hyena populations. The game-viewing can be exceptional, and the wide variety of activities make this an area not to be missed. Savuti's almost desert-like landscape with a scorching sun, loose, hot sand, animals escaping the heat by clumping together in the limited available shade, and elephants lining up to get to the water supply, offer a wildlife experience you won't easily forget.

On arrival, check in, relax and unwind. Lunch can be enjoyed at the lodge, after which you will enjoy your first afternoon safari activity.

Day 5 :
Explore Savute

Enjoy a morning and afternoon game drive in the Savute area today. Activities are organised around game drives throughout the Savute area in open 4x4 safari vehicles. Many trips will incorporate a visit to the Savute Marsh to give you a chance to see the historic presence of the Savute Channel at the marsh against a backdrop of teeming wildlife.

Daily itinerary:

05:30 Morning wake-up call.
06:00 Light continental breakfast served in the dining area.
06:30 Leave for morning activity, (approximately 3 – 4 hours).
11:30 Brunch is served at the dining area.
Siesta time Relax and enjoy the lodge facilities and surroundings.
15:00 Afternoon tea is served on the open air patio.
15:30 Depart for afternoon activity (approximately 3 hours).
18:30 Arrive back at the lodge.
19:30 Dinner is served at the dining area.

Day 6 :
Last day in Savute

Enjoy a morning and afternoon game drive in the Savute area today. Or, why not relax at the lodge and enjoy the amenities on offer here.

Sink into one of the numerous comfortable sofas in the lounge – and library – or sip a cocktail in the stylish bar. Savute Safari Lodge offers a shaded viewing deck, an al fresco dining area and swimming pool with spectacular pool loungers – ideal for watching the varied wildlife – including the resident Elephants – as they make their way to the Channel to drink, bathe and play.

Day 7 :
Savute to the Okavango Delta

After your last morning safari activity in Savute, and breakfast, say your final goodbyes and check out. From here you will enjoy a short transfer to the nearby airstrip.

Enjoy a charter flight transfer to Camp Okavango located in the iconic Okavango Delta. Camp Okavango, a unique and exclusive African safari camp is situated on the remote Nxaragha Island. This hidden treasure, in the heart of the permanent Okavango Delta, assures its guests of an unparalleled year-round water wilderness experience.

A maze of sparkling lagoons, meandering channels and overgrown islands teeming with wildlife, Botswana’s Okavango Delta (a World Heritage site) lies like a sparkling jewel at the heart of the Kalahari Desert. Adapted for a life in and out of water, the elegant red lechwe and shy sitatunga antelope are found in this watery wilderness. Lion, cheetah, leopard and African wild dog also share the floodplains with large herds of elephant and buffalo.

Check in, relax and unwind before enjoying something to eat and drink. Later on, you will depart on your first afternoon safari activity in this watery wilderness. To experience the true magic of the Okavango Delta this camp offers only water-based activities, including boat cruises, mokoro excursions and bush walks.

Day 8 :
Explore the Delta

Enjoy a range of water-based activities today with experienced and professional guides. Guided bush walks are also on offer.

Water-based activities are conducted by experienced professional guides who will expertly navigate guests through the many meandering, reed-lined waterways. Roam the vast expanses of water from the comfort of a modern motorboat or explore the intricacies of the Okavango Delta the quiet old-fashioned way, in the traditional mokoro (dugout canoe).

For those wanting to get a little closer to nature, guided bush walks are conducted on a number of the nearby islands, offering an opportunity to track some of the larger land-based species that inhabit this water wilderness. Birding opportunities are outstanding, and anglers may put their skill against bream and tiger fish.

Daily itinerary:

05:30 Early morning wake-up call.
06:00 Light continental breakfast served in the dining area.
06:30 Leave for morning activity, (approximately 3 – 4 hours).
11:30 Brunch is served at the dining area.
Siesta time Relax and enjoy the lodge facilities and surroundings.
15:00 Afternoon tea is served on the open-air patio.
15:30 Depart for afternoon activity (approximately 3 hours).
18:30 Arrive back at the lodge.
19:30 Dinner is served at the dining area.

Day 9 :
Last day in the Delta

Enjoy a range of water-based activities today with experienced and professional guides. Guided bush walks are also on offer. Or, maybe you will prefer to relax and rather enjoy the lodge and its amenities?

Camp Okavango’s main area comprises of a network of interconnected walkways linking up two lounge areas, a dining room, library, self-service bar and curio shop. Sweeping ramps lead to the lower level deck with two open-air fire pits and comfortable seating areas to relax and take in the natural surroundings. There is a third deck with a rim flow swimming pool and thatched lounge deck for those warm summer days.

Day 10 :
Departure

After your last morning safari and breakfast, you will be transferred to the local airstrip. From here you will fly to Maun Airport.

On arrival in Maun you will board a direct flight to Johannesburg.

Let Jewel of Africa Safaris Help You with Your Next Safari

The expert team at Jewel of Africa Safaris is here to help you to plan your tailormade Highlights of Botswana Safari. Whether you prefer desert sand, sea or bush experiences, we make sure you travel in luxury.

ENQUIRE NOW
FIND OUT MORE

Tours by Destination

  • Botswana
  • Namibia
  • South Africa
  • Uganda
  • Zambia
  • Zimbabwe
  • All Destinations
SEE MORE

Experiences

  • Adventure
  • Big 5 Wildlife
  • Birding
  • Culture & History
  • Desert & Dunes
  • Family Friendly
  • Gorilla Trekking
  • Island & Beach
  • Luxury & Beach
  • Ocean & Coastal
  • Photographic
  • Private Guided
  • Romantic & Honeymoon
  • Water & River
  • Whale Watching
  • Wine & Dine
  • All Experiences

content.rendered:
Ultimate Bush & Beach Safari

This safari combines a luxury bush safari in the Kruger National Park with a luxury beach experience in Mozambique.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $4915
/ Starting from / per person sharing

Your luxury bush and beach safari start in the Southern Kruger National Park. The intimate Camp Shawu Lodge, overlooking the Mpanamana lake, offers luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality and excellent morning and afternoon Big 5 game viewing, beyond expectation, in a private concession, bordering the Crocodile River. Experience magnificent sunsets, all manners of predators and prey at the watering hole, early morning or late afternoon game drives in search of the ‘Big 5‘ with an expert guide, boma fires under an African sky, a pampering at the spa, a splash in the pool, sundowners in the bush and endless photo opportunities.

Your beach safari takes you to the secluded Santa Maria Peninsula, reached by boat from Maputo. Here you will be spoiled by luxury ocean view rooms, endless white beaches, pristine and untouched dune forests, estuaries bursting with life and eternally wide-open ocean. This magnificent environment, surrounded by 5 marine and nature reserves and the nearby Inhaca Island offers the ideal setting for swimming, snorkelling, diving, birdwatching, canoeing, dhow cruises and beach picnics.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 7 Days 6 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Kruger National Park
  • Maputo, Mozambique
  • Santa Maria Peninsula, Mozambique

Included

  • All Transfers
  • Drinks
  • Local Flights
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Safari Activities

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  • The Kruger National Park, the largest game reserve in South Africa
  • Morning and Afternoon Big 5 Game Drives
  • Mozambique
  • Scuba & Snorkelling
  • Romantic Beach picnics
  • Show cruises

Map & Destinations

Kruger National Park
Maputo, Mozambique
Santa Maria Peninsula, Mozambique

Kruger National Park

The world-renowned Kruger National Park is the largest game reserve in South Africa and is definitely one of the must-visit destinations in South Africa. This is a wildlife sanctuary like no other, offering magical unpredictability and endless wilderness that is the true quality of Africa. This is the land of baobabs, fever trees, knob thorns, marula and mopane trees underneath which lurk the Big Five, and more species of mammals and birds than any other African Game Reserve.

Mozambique

Mozambique is a southern African nation whose long Indian Ocean coastline is dotted with popular beaches like Tofo, as well as offshore marine parks. The Bazaruto Archipelago farther south has reefs which protect rare marine life including dugongs. The current capital, Maputo, is known for its diverse architecture, vibrant nightlife and relative proximity to beaches like Ponta do Ouro. Inland, Gorongosa National Park’s forests, wetlands and savannahs shelter wildlife including lions, hippos and zebras. In Niassa National Reserve, near Tanzania, animals including elephants and wildebeest live in the wild.

Santa Maria Peninsula

Discover this wild, untouched piece of land jutting into the Indian Ocean on the eastern side of Maputo Bay, close to Inhaca Island. Indulge in world class fishing, exquisite bird sightings, and mind-boggling snorkeling. The Santa Maria Peninsula is one of the best Mozambique holiday destinations that offer all year-round satisfaction. Scuba divers explore the depths of the Santa Maria reefs offshore while other tourists indulge in boat trips to the biodiverse beauty of Inhaca Island. Or enjoy a day cruise to Portuguese Island for lunch. Drive a few kilometers inland from the peninsula to explore the important Maputo Elephant Reserve, once home to abundant herds of antelope and elephants.

itineraries.title: Arrive in the Kruger National Park
itineraries.content:
On arrival in South Africa, board a flight to Nelspruit Airport, your gateway to Kruger.

You will be met on arrival and transferred to the iconic Kruger National Park, and onwards to Camp Shawu Lodge.

On arrival, you will check-in to your luxury room, have some time to freshen up and enjoy something to eat and drink before heading out for your first afternoon game drive with your ranger. You will enjoy a beautiful sunset and some snacks and drinks along the way. As night falls you will return to camp while searching for the nocturnal creatures with the spotlight.

Return to camp, freshen up and share your stories while you dine on traditional cuisine around a roaring boma fire under the African night sky.

itineraries.title: Game Drives in Kruger
itineraries.content:
The early morning and afternoon game drives led by rangers and trackers are the perfect way to view the wildlife in comfort.

A typical day might look something like this:

Early morning:
An early start means an early wake-up call. Tea and coffee are served at about 6am and at sunrise you head off on your early-morning game-drive. This is generally the best time to spot the wildlife, as the temperature is cool, and the animals are still very active, including the big cats, which will be returning from a night of hunting.
Late morning
After a few hours, you will either return to your camp for a hearty breakfast.
Lunch and afternoon
You usually have lunch in the camp and spend the main part of the day either relaxing or using the amenities, including the gym, outdoor pool and spa. You might have something to eat and drink at around 3pm before heading out for another safari drive.
Evening
As with early morning, the evening game drive is often the best time to see the wildlife. The predatory animals begin to stir from their heat-of-the-day slumber, and similarly, their prey become ever more active and alert as darkness falls. Vehicles usually return just before dark in time for a shower, pre-dinner drinks and then dinner. The evenings are often rounded off with a few drinks around the campfire, warming toes and swapping safari stories.

itineraries.content:

A typical day might look something like this:

Early morning
An early start means an equally early wake-up call. Tea and coffee are served at about 6am and at sunrise you head off on your early-morning game-drive. This is generally the best time to spot the wildlife, as the temperature is cool, and the animals are still very active, including the big cats, which will be returning from a night of hunting.

Evening
As with early morning, the evening game drive is often the best time to see the wildlife. The predatory animals begin to stir from their heat-of-the-day slumber, and similarly, their prey become ever more active and alert as darkness falls. Vehicles usually return just before dark in time for a shower, pre-dinner drinks and then dinner. The evenings are often rounded off with a few drinks around the campfire, warming toes and swapping safari stories.

After a hearty lunch, transfer to Bigodi to visit a local community initiative - the Bigodi Wetland Walk. Be on the lookout for primates and the rare great blue turaco, one of the 138 bird species found in the swamp area.

Dinner will be enjoyed at the lodge.

title.rendered: The Ultimate All-Inclusive Sabi Sand Safari

content.rendered:
The Ultimate All-Inclusive Sabi Sand Safari

Experience a luxury, all-inclusive Big 5 Africa safari in the renowned MalaMala Private Game Reserve situated within the Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve. MalaMala, an award-winning Big 5 private game reserve is situated on the Sand River and offers guests excellent service and hospitality, gourmet dining, and incredible wildlife experiences.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $5065
/ Starting from / per person sharing

Experience a luxury, all-inclusive safari at MalaMala in the renowned Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve.

MalaMala, an award-winning Big 5 private game reserve is situated on the Sand River and offers guests excellent service and hospitality, gourmet dining, and incredible wildlife experiences during daily game drives (in open 4×4 vehicles) and nature walks.

As the oldest and one of the largest private Big 5 game reserves in South Africa, sharing an unfenced boundary with the Kruger National Park, MalaMala boasts with the finest and most consistent Big 5 game viewing in Africa, especially regarding sightings of lion and leopard.

The perennial river acts as a magnet for animals in this pristine wildlife area and is the foundation of MalaMala’s unrivalled game viewing and wildlife experience. Especially interesting is that every pride of lion and individual leopard you see here is known to the rangers, making each sighting that much more personal and intimate.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 4 Days 3 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Mala Mala Private Game Reserve
  • Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  •  All-inclusive & exclusive MalaMala safari experience
  • Set on the Sand River which draws the wildlife closer
  • Incredible consistent Big 5 game viewing
  • Unrivalled daily lion and leopard sightings
  • Morning, Afternoon and night drives
  • Walking safaris

Map & Destinations

Mala Mala Private Game Reserve
Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve

Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve

The Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve is one of South Africa’s premium safari reserves offering the ultimate safari experience in the Greater Kruger National Park. With no fences between the reserve and the Kruger National Park, all species of wildlife, including the Big 5 move through here freely. Your stay here will include luxury 5-star accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality and the best wildlife sightings in Kruger! This area is especially renowned for its incredible leopard sightings.

Mala Mala Private Game Reserve

Mala Mala is a game reserve located within the Sabi Sand Game Reserve, Mpumalanga province, South Africa. It is the largest and the oldest private big five game reserve in South Africa. It covers 13 300ha (33 000 acres), shares a 19km (12 mile) unfenced boundary with the world-renowned Kruger National Park and lies strategically sandwiched between the Kruger and the Sabi Sand Reserve. Importantly, MalaMala has 20 kms (13 miles) of Sand River frontage. This perennial river acts as a magnet for animals in this pristine wildlife area and is the foundation of Mala Mala’s unrivalled game viewing and wildlife experience.

itineraries.title: Arrive at MalaMala
itineraries.content: On arrival in Johannesburg, board a flight to Skukuza Airport or the MalaMala Airstrip. On arrival, you will be met by your ranger and transferred to MalaMala, in the Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve. Check-in to your luxury room or suite at either MalaMala Main Camp, Sable Camp or Rattray’s Camp, relax and enjoy lunch before heading off on your first afternoon safari drive in the Mala Mala Private Game Reserve. Day turns to dusk as you enjoy sundowner drinks and snacks at a scenic spot along the way. On your way back to camp spotlights are turned on and the search begins for nocturnal wildlife. Return to your room after sunset and freshen up before a delicious dinner and fine wines are served in the dining room, on the safari deck or around the fire in the boma area.

itineraries.title: Explore Mala Mala
itineraries.content: Have fun with a full day of exciting safari activities at MalaMala. Your day itinerary may run as follows: An early wake-up call by your ranger heralds the dawn. Meet your ranger and safari companions on the safari deck as the sun rises over the bushveld. Hot and cold beverages and a light snack are available. The early morning game drive follows. Return to camp where a hearty breakfast awaits you in the air- conditioned dining room or on the expansive safari deck. For the more energetic, join the bush walk after breakfast. A buffet lunch is served though some prefer to sleep through after their later breakfast. Meet on the expansive safari deck for hot and cold beverages and a light snack before departing on another unforgettable safari, with a sundowner stop along the way. Return to camp allowing time for you to freshen up before meeting your friends and rangers for pre-dinner drinks in the cosy Safari Bar. Enjoy the superb food and excellent wines while sharing stories about the day’s sightings with your fellow travellers.

itineraries.title: Last morning safari and departure
itineraries.content: After you last morning safari activity, and breakfast, check out and make your way to the Skukuza Airport or the nearby airstrip. From here you will fly back to Johannesburg.

title.rendered: Spectacular Sabi Sand & Timbavati Private Safari

description:
This luxury safari allows you to visit two of the most highly rated destinations in the Kruger area: The Sabi Sand and Timbavati Private Game Reserves. Here you will be spoiled with luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality and the best game viewing possible.

The Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve is one of South Africa’s premium safari reserves offering the ultimate safari experience in the Greater Kruger National Park. With no fences between the reserve and the Kruger National Park, all species of wildlife, including the Big 5 move through here freely. This area is especially renowned for its incredible leopard sightings.

The exclusive Timbavati Private Game Reserve lies in the western region of the Kruger National Park, north of the Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve. This reserve is renowned for the population of white lions that roam this area. The Ngala Private Game Reserve located within the Timbavati is particularly well known for its large prides of lion and occasional sightings of wild dog, as well as large herds of elephant and buffalo.

*This tour can be changed according to your specific needs and requirements

Timbavati Private Game Reserve

The exclusive Timbavati Private Game Reserve lies in the western region of the Kruger National Park, north of the Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve. The large tracts of land that make up the Timbavati Game Reserve remain largely unspoiled and wild. This reserve is renowned for the population of white lions that roam this area. These genetically rare specimens are not albino lions but are listed as a sub-species of lion. Here you can also hope to see elephant, cheetah, lion, buffalo, rhino, over 360 bird species, 79 reptiles and over 80 species of trees.

itineraries.title: Johannesburg to Sabi Sand
itineraries.content: Board a flight from Johannesburg to Skukuza Airport in the Kruger National Park. On arrival, a ranger from the lodge will meet you and transfer you to the Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve. On arrival at Kirkman’s Camp, you have time to check in and freshen before lunch/afternoon tea is served and after this you will go on your first afternoon safari drive. Day turns to dusk where you will stop for a sundowner drink and snacks. Spotlights are turned on and the search for nocturnal predators begins in all earnest. Return to camp well after dark and freshen up. Dinner is a fancy affair with superb food prepared by top-class chefs. Lull yourself to sleep with the sound of roaring lions or the relaxing night sounds only the African bush can provide.

itineraries.title: Unrivalled Sabi Sand game-viewing
itineraries.content: Daily early morning and afternoon game drives led by expert rangers and trackers are the perfect way to view the wildlife in comfort. You can also enjoy interesting guided bush walks which are a great way to learn about the fascinating flora and fauna in the region. A typical day might look something like this: Early morning An early start means an equally early wake-up call. Tea and coffee are served at about 6am and at sunrise you head off on your early-morning game-drive. Late morning After a few hours, you will either return to your camp for a hearty breakfast or have a bush breakfast out on the plains and then return just before the heat of the day. Lunch and afternoon You usually have lunch in the camp and spend the main part of the day either relaxing or using the amenities, such as an outdoor pool. Your ranger is always on standby for an educational bush walk. You might have something to eat and drink at around 3pm before heading out for another safari drive. Evening As with early morning, the evening game drive is often the best time to see the wildlife. Vehicles usually return just before dark in time for a shower, pre-dinner drinks and then dinner. The evenings are often rounded off with a few drinks around the campfire, warming toes and swapping safari stories.

itineraries.title: Explore the Sabi Sand further
itineraries.content: Same as on Day 2

itineraries.title: From Sabi Sand to Timbavati
itineraries.content: After your last morning safari activity, you will check out at around 11:00AM and be transferred to the Timbavati Private Game Reserve. Here you will be staying at Ngala Safari Lodge.   Ngala Safari Lodge is a gracious, colonial-style safari lodge set on the very edge of the Kruger National Park in the Timbavati Game Reserve. Check in to your luxury cottage and enjoy a late lunch/afternoon tea. You will depart on your first afternoon safari drive late-afternoon. The afternoon game drive continues into the early evening with the use of powerful spotlights. Return to the lodge after dark and enjoy some time to freshen up before enjoying a delicious dinner in the dining room which open ups to the African bushveld.

itineraries.title: Game drives and walks in the Timbavati
itineraries.content: Enjoy an early morning game drive with your ranger. Interpretive nature walks are also on offer. On your return breakfast will be enjoyed and after noon lunch will be served. The afternoon allows you some time to relax and enjoy the comforts of your cottage or the lodge amenities. Before venturing out again on your afternoon safari, enjoy some sweet and savoury treats for afternoon tea. Return to the lodge after dark and enjoy some time to freshen up before enjoying a delicious dinner in the dining room which open up to the African bushveld.

itineraries.title: Another full day in the Timbavati
itineraries.content:
Today you can decide whether you want to take part in either a morning and afternoon game drive or an interpretive nature walk. Other activities on offer here include (at extra cost): 
✓ Tracking Adventure on Foot 
✓ Photographic Safari in Photographic Safari Vehicle 
✓ Rhino Notching 
✓ Ngala Safari Lodge Spa

itineraries.title: Departure
itineraries.content: After your last morning safari activity, check out and say your final goodbyes before being transferred to Hoedspruit Airport for your flight to Johannesburg.

content.rendered:
Luxury Treehouse Honeymoon Safari

Rather than the dress, tux, cake, flowers… it is the memories made together that will last a lifetime – and there are few experiences more unforgettable than your safari honeymoon.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $4875
/ Starting from / per person sharing

Rather than the dress, tux, cake, flowers… it is the memories made together that will last a lifetime – and there are few experiences more unforgettable than your safari honeymoon.

At Lion Sands we combine incomparable luxury with authentic adventure, setting the rhythm between relaxing and exploring. Here, you get to be together, just the two of you, in the most exotic, tranquil destination.

On a Lion Sands honeymoon safari, you can sleep out in a Treehouse underneath the Milky Way one night, and in a private luxury suite between bushveld and the Sabie River the next. The guiding and hospitality teams will go the extra mile to make this an experience you’ll reminisce about for years to come.

Be spoilt by lie-ins and champagne at breakfast, alfresco showers and rose petal baths, bush spa therapies and poolside safaris, afternoon tea and dinner in a secret location…and so much more!

*You can choose to stay at any one of the four Lion Sands lodges for your honeymoon.

*Three different treehouse experiences are available in Lion Sands, depending on the location of the lodge.

*This honeymoon safari can be customized as per your preferences.

Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve
Lion Sands Private Game Reserve

Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve

The Sabi Sand Private Game Reserve is one of South Africa’s premium safari reserves offering the ultimate safari experience in the Greater Kruger National Park. With no fences between the reserve and the Kruger National Park, all species of wildlife, including the Big 5 move through here freely. Your stay here will include luxury 5-star accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality and the best wildlife sightings in Kruger! This area is especially renowned for its incredible leopard sightings.

Lion Sands Private Game Reserve

Family owned since 1933, this international award-winning private game reserve spans across both the world famous Sabi Sand Game Reserve and Kruger National Park. Lion Sands has four lodges; each has a unique style but reflects Lion Sands' five-star signature of sophisticated interiors, unique experiences and service excellence. Lion Sands is also renowned for the three treehouses available for romantic sleep-out experiences.

itineraries.title: Arrive in Lion Sands
itineraries.content:
On arrival in South Africa, board a flight from Johannesburg to Skukuza Airport, your gateway to the Sabi Sand. This is where your special honeymoon experience begins.

On arrival you will be met by a representative of Lion Sands and transferred to your luxury Lion Sands lodge for check in. Greeted with a warm welcome and beverage, relax and settle in before enjoying a late lunch or afternoon tea with views of the Sabie River.

Later in the afternoon you will head out on your first game drive in the Lion Sand Private Game Reserve. During the drive you will stop for sundowner drinks and as the sun sets your ranger will start looking for nocturnal predators with the aid of a spotlight.

Once back at the lodge, freshen up and enjoy pre-dinner drinks and a delectable dinner under the African night sky.

itineraries.title: Explore Lion Sands
itineraries.content:
Today you have a full day to experience and explore the beautiful Lion Sands Private Game Reserve during a morning and afternoon game drive and fully immersive bush walks.

Game drives, in open safari vehicles (with only 6 guests per vehicle), head out each day at sunrise and again in the late afternoon. Lion Sand’s natural animal population includes the Big Five, and the reserve is especially renowned for the quality of its leopard viewing – the most elusive of predators. With exclusive traversing rights on both Lion Sands’ Sabi Sand and Kruger Park sections, guests are assured a truly intimate safari experience.

After breakfast, you can enjoy a bush walk where guests are immersed in the bush, rather than just observing it. All five senses are engaged, as they feel scrub crunch beneath their feet, touch the velvety acacia seed pod, hear the crack of a branch indicating they are not alone, and spot big game at eye level – exhilarating! Our expert guides will tailor walks to each of our guest’s area/s of interest, focusing on mammals, birds, insects, plants, geology, etc.

In-between your activities, enjoy the special time shared with each other around the lunch and dinner table or at the swimming pool. Private and romantic meals can be arranged on request. Or, why not head to the spa for some honeymoon pampering?

itineraries.title: Sleep under the stars in a treehouse
itineraries.content:
Your day will be filled with excitement with a morning and afternoon game drive and morning bush walk on offer. Or, you can choose to lie-in and spend the morning relaxing in the comfort of your private suite.

After your afternoon game drive, your ranger will allow you time to pack an overnight bag for your romantic sleep-out under the starts at one of the nearby treehouses.

The million-star Chalkley and Kingston (Sabi Sand) treehouses are the ultimate bush bedrooms, where romantics can discover the magic of a night out in Africa – in complete luxury. Guests arrive at sunset to a gourmet picnic dinner, spend the dusk hours watching animals wander past (at a safe distance), and fall asleep counting shooting stars. And they can rest easy knowing a ranger is always on radio call, should they feel they need assistance.

itineraries.title: Departure
itineraries.content:
After an early wake-up call at the treehouse and a warm drink, watch the sun rise over the trees before embarking on your last morning game drive in the Lion Sands. Return to the lodge for breakfast and say your final goodbyes. A short transfer will take you back to Skukuza Airport for your flight to Johannesburg.

You will remember this honeymoon safari for years to come.

title.rendered: Magnificent Victoria Falls, Chobe River & Okavango Delta Safari

content.rendered:
Magnificent Victoria Falls, Chobe River & Okavango Delta Safari

Experience a quality luxury Africa safari at three of the top destinations in Southern Africa, including Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe and the Chobe National Park and Moremi Game Reserve in Botswana. Get up close to the majestic Victoria Falls, cruise the Zambezi and Chobe Rivers and experience the impressive wildlife in Moremi for yourself.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $8525
/ Starting from / per person sharing
Experience one of the best tourism offerings in Southern Africa during this 9 Day Luxury Zimbabwe and Botswana Safari. This safari combines three of the top destinations in these beautiful countries, including the Victoria Falls, Chobe National Park, and the Moremi Game Reserve. This safari offers you luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality, effortless travelling and incredibly scenic destinations combined with unrivalled land-and water-based safari activities in some of the most wild and unspoilt wilderness areas in Africa. Get up close to the majestic Victoria Falls, cruise the Zambezi and Chobe Rivers and experience the impressive wildlife in Moremi for yourself.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 9 Days 8 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe
  • Chobe National Park, Botswana
  • Moremi Game Reserve, Botswana

Included

  • Charter Flights
  • Conservation Fees
  • Drinks
  • Laundry
  • Local Flights
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Safari Activities

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.
  • See the majestic Victoria Falls and feel it thundering around you
  • Zambezi River sunset cruise with excellent hippo and crocodile sightings
  • Dinner & Drum show in Victoria Falls – for unique African dining
  • Chobe National Park game drives – see the largest herds of elephant in Africa
  • Chobe River cruises – for top water-based game-viewing
  • Moremi Game Reserve game drives – a true wilderness game viewing experience
  • Moremi Game Reserve boat cruises for top water-based game-viewing

Map & Destinations

Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe
Chobe National Park, Botswana
Moremi Game Reserve, Botswana

Victoria Falls

The Victoria Falls constitutes one of the most spectacular natural wonders of the world and is a must-visit site for any traveler. The local people call it "Mosi-oa-Tunya", the smoke that thunders and the Zambezi River and its epic waterfall forms the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe. The Victoria falls is 1 708 meters wide, making it the largest curtain of water in the world. Besides the Falls, the Zambezi River and the National Parks in the vicinity of the Falls offers visitors a range of adrenaline and leisure-based activities.

Chobe National Park

Chobe National Park, one of the largest Parks in Botswana is situated in north-east Botswana on the banks of the Chobe River. Due to Chobe National Park’s location close to some of the Africa’s most visited natural attractions, this is an ideal safari destination. The Park is biologically diverse and boasts with the highest concentration of elephants in the world. The wildlife and scenery can be enjoyed during game drives, bush walks and boat cruises which are on offer at all lodges and hotels.

Moremi Game Reserve

Moremi Game Reserve can be found in the eastern section of the Okavango Delta and is an excellent safari destination. The Reserve is one of the most spectacular wildlife conservancies in Botswana, where an abundance of wildlife moves around freely. The unique landscape features a unique mix of dry ecosystems as well as wetlands. Among the roamers of the bush are the Big Five, but this is also a hotspot for a profusion of unique bird species.

itineraries.title: Arrival in Victoria Falls
itineraries.content:
Board your flight from Johannesburg to Victoria Falls Airport in Zimbabwe.

Upon arrival at the airport, you will be transferred to your hotel for check in. The 5-star Victoria Falls Hotel offers luxury rooms, high levels of service and hospitality and direct, access to the Falls throughout the day.

A complimentary sunset boat cruise on the majestic Zambezi River is the perfect way to end the day. Drinks and snacks are included, and you might get the chance to see hippo, crocodile and elephant and an array of amazing birdlife.

itineraries.title: Explore Victoria Falls
itineraries.content:
Enjoy a scrumptious breakfast before you depart on a guided tour of the majestic Victoria Falls.

 

Guests will be accompanied through the rainforest, on the edge of the Falls, and your guide will give you a brief history of the Falls as well as detailing the flora, fauna and other points of interest. Raincoats are provided when needed to protect you against the spray from the Falls.

You will make your way along the designated path which takes you to the various 16 viewpoints along the edge

After your guided tour the rest of the day will be spent at leisure enjoying any of the other activities on offer here. Lunch can be enjoyed at your hotel.

In the evening, get ready for a culture-focused dinner at The Boma Restaurant. This is an unforgettable combination of entertainment and four-course dining and is highly recommended.

itineraries.title: Victoria Falls to Chobe
itineraries.content:
After breakfast you have the morning at leisure, before our ground crew will transfer you to Chobe National Park in Botswana.

Chobe Game Lodge is an elegant, five-star, fully eco-graded safari lodge and the only permanent property located inside the world-renowned Chobe National Park and set on the banks of the famous Chobe River. Your room is river-facing and air-conditioned, featuring overhead fans, complimentary mini bar, an en-suite bathroom and a private terrace.

Check in, enjoy afternoon tea and get ready for your first afternoon safari drive in open 4x4 vehicle in the Park.

You will return after sunset and have time to freshen up before dinner is served in the dining area or open-air boma.

itineraries.title: Explore Chobe
itineraries.content:
Chobe Game Lodge offers a choice of land or water-based activities and the most complete animal-viewing experience in the Chobe National Park.

 

Early-morning and late-afternoon game drives are conducted by expert guides in open-sided 4x4 vehicles to ensure maximum visibility of Chobe National Park’s spectacular scenery and abundant wildlife. Meanwhile, riverside game viewing may be done from small and highly manoeuvrable boats, perfect for morning or sunset cruises.

A typical day in Chobe National Park is as follows:

5:00 - Tea and coffee and light breakfast is served
6:00 - Depart for a morning safari activity
9:30 - Return to camp for breakfast
12:30 - Lunch
15:00 - Afternoon tea
15:30 - Afternoon/Evening safari activity
18:30 - Return to camp
19:30 - Dinner is served

itineraries.title: Last Day in Chobe
itineraries.content:
Enjoy your last day in the Chobe National Park. You can enjoy a morning and afternoon game drive or boat cruise or decide to stay at the lodge and relax and enjoy the beautiful views from your room.

Chobe Game Lodge is designed as a haven of peace and privacy – where relaxation is effortless, and you can enjoy your own space. With six comfortably furnished viewing decks, a riverside boma, two bars, six different lounges and four dining locations, a comfy chair or lounger is never far away, each with a different perspective on the wilderness that surrounds the lodge. A large swimming pool provides welcome relief during hot afternoons and there is always a waiter on hand to bring you refreshments from the bar.

Guests wishing to pamper themselves are welcome to book one of the delightful treatments from the in-house beautician or hit the gym for some exercise between the usual Lodge activities.

itineraries.title: Chobe to Moremi
itineraries.content:
After your last morning safari activity and breakfast, check out and enjoy a short transfer to Kasane Airport. From here you will be transferred by charter flight to your luxury lodge located in the Moremi Game Reserve.

Camp Moremi has a well-deserved legacy in the Botswana tourism industry for being able to deliver the classic African safari experience. Recently completely rebuilt, Camp Moremi is located within Botswana’s world-renowned Moremi Game Reserve, situated on the edge of the Xakanaxa Lagoon in an area known for its spectacular game-viewing opportunities.

On arrival, check in, relax and unwind. Lunch can be enjoyed at the lodge, after which you will enjoy your first afternoon safari activity. Activities on offer include game drives and boat cruises.

Return after dark, freshen up and enjoy dinner in the outside boma area or dining area.

itineraries.title: Explore Moremi
itineraries.content:
Guest activities include a choice of morning and afternoon game drives throughout the many different ecosystems that the Moremi Game Reserve has to offer or the possibility to explore the Xakanaxa Lagoon and its surrounding channels by boat.

 

This blend of activities allow for access to incredible landscapes, impressive wildlife as well as the opportunity to enjoy the picturesque waters of the Okavango Delta.

A typical day in Moremi is as follows:

5:00 - We have tea, coffee, and a simple breakfast
6:00 - Begin the morning safari activity
9:30 - Head back to the camp for another breakfast
12:30 - Time for lunch
15:00 - End of the day tea
15:30 - Evening safari activity
18:30 - Head back to camp
19:30 - Time for a delicious dinner

itineraries.title: Last day in Moremi
itineraries.content:
Enjoy your last day in the Moremi Game Reserve. You can enjoy a morning and afternoon game drive or boat cruise or decide to stay at the lodge and relax and enjoy the beautiful views from your room or the communal areas.

 

Camp Moremi’s communal areas includes a sunken bar, masterfully built around a large termite mound and ebony tree, an expansive lounge area with beautiful brass and soft finishes, leading towards an extended library and private deck. These areas, including the elevated dining area, connects by boardwalk to the fireplace in front of the camp. In addition, an open air boma and secluded swimming pool complement the public area facilities.

itineraries.title: Departure
itineraries.content:
After your last morning safari and breakfast, you will be transferred to the local airstrip. From here you will fly to Maun Airport.

On arrival in Maun you will board a direct flight to Johannesburg.

content.rendered:
Iconic Cape Town & Kruger Safari

Combining two must-visit South Africa destinations, this safari offers unbeatable luxury and value, including the services of a private tour guide in both Cape Town and Kruger. Visit one of the most beautiful cities in the world and the largest game reserve in South Africa for an all-in-one Africa safari.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $5575
/ Starting from / per person sharing

Combining two of the must-visit destinations in South Africa, this safari offers unbeatable luxury and value, including the services of a tour guide in both Cape Town and Kruger.

Cape Town is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.

The luxury Kruger safari portion offers you access to high quality accommodation and service and some of the best wildlife and scenic destinations in the Kruger area. You will be sure to see some or all of the Big 5 mammals on this trip.

Explore the African wilderness on a full day private safari in the Kruger National Park, enjoy the breath-taking Canyons and Waterfalls on the Panorama Route and experience the magic of the Manyeleti Private Game Reserve with both a morning and evening game drive in open 4×4 vehicle. Bush walks are also available here.

*This tour can be changed according to your specific needs and requirements.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 6 Days 7 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Cape Town, South Africa / Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Cape Town
  • Cape Winelands
  • Kruger National Park
  • Manyeleti Private Game Reserve

Included

  • Conservation Fees
  • Drinks
  • Local Flights
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Private Guide and Vehicle
  • Safari Activities

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  • Fully guided tour with a private tour guide as your host
  • Ride up to the summit of Table Mountain by cablecar
  •  Cape Town City tour
  •  Cape Peninsula Tour – one of the most scenic drives in the Cape
  • Explore the Cape Winelands for fine wine tasting and dining
  • The iconic Kruger National Park, a wildlife sanctuary like no other
  • The scenic Panorama Route and Blyde River Canyon
  • Morning and afternoon game drives in the Manyeleti Private Game Reserve (Big 5)
  • Endangered Species Centre tour

Map & Destinations

Cape Town
Cape Point
Stellenbosch
Franschhoek
Kruger National Park
Manyeleti Private Game Reserve

Cape Town

Cape Town, nicknamed the Mother City, is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.

Cape Winelands

The Cape Winelands of the Western Cape are one of the big draw cards to South Africa that manage to effortlessly combine the beauty of ripening vineyards, Cape Dutch manor homes and excellent cuisine (and of course award-winning wine) in valleys surrounded by indigo mountains. The towns of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek are within easy reach of Cape Town and are some of the oldest towns in the country with a rich history and culture.

Kruger National Park

The world-renowned Kruger National Park is the largest game reserve in South Africa and is definitely one of the must-visit destinations in South Africa. This is a wildlife sanctuary like no other, offering magical unpredictability and endless wilderness that is the true quality of Africa. This is the land of baobabs, fever trees, knob thorns, marula and mopane trees underneath which lurk the Big Five, and more species of mammals and birds than any other African Game Reserve.

Manyeleti Private Game Reserve

Expect a pristine bush experience in one of the world's most beautiful places. This private game reserve borders directly to the vast Kruger National Park, as well as the famous Sabi Sands and Timbavati Game Reserves.

As such, you can be sure to only experience the best game viewing possible. As there are no fences between the national park and the private game reserves, wildlife is able to roam freely. Manyeleti is prime “Big Five” territory, offering good possibilities for viewing the elusive leopard. Other Big Five animals (lion, rhino, buffalo and elephant) are also spotted on a very regular basis. Furthermore, with more than 300 bird species present in the area, Manyeleti makes a great safari destination for wildlife enthusiasts, photographers and bird watchers alike.

itineraries.title: Meet & Greet in Cape Town
itineraries.content:
Your Jewel of Africa Safaris tour guide will meet you at Cape Town International Airport on arrival.

The day will be devoted to exploring the City of Cape Town. Stops will include the Company Gardens, the Castle of Good Hope, Signal Hill and Camps Bay. After time for lunch in Camps Bay, you will make your way to the summit of Table Mountain with the cable car.

Later, check in to The Commodore Hotel and freshen up, before enjoying dinner at one of the excellent restaurants the V&A Waterfront has to offer.

itineraries.title: Cape Peninsula Tour
itineraries.content:
Enjoy one of the most scenic drives in the Cape region today, departing for Hout Bay after breakfast.

Your first stop is Hout Bay harbor, where you will embark on a 45-minute boat cruise to Seal Island to view a large fur-seal colony.

From here the famous Chapman’s Peak Drive leads you to the Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve and Cape Point.

On our way back to Cape Town a visit is also made to Boulders Beach, an ideal vantage point to watch the local colony of endangered African penguins that call this beach their home.

itineraries.title: Cape Winelands
itineraries.content:
We leave Cape Town behind and take a 40-minute drive to the Cape Winelands.

The Cape Winelands of the Western Cape are one of the big draw cards to South Africa that manage to effortlessly combine the beauty of ripening vineyards, Cape Dutch manor homes and excellent cuisine (and of course award-winning wine) in valleys surrounded by indigo mountains.

The towns of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek are within easy reach of Cape Town and are some of the oldest towns in the country with a rich history and culture.

We explore these towns are the surrounding wine estates before we make our way back to Cape Town.

itineraries.title: Cape Town to Kruger
itineraries.content:
From Cape Town board a direct flight to Hoedspruit, your gateway to Kruger. You will be met by your Jewel of Africa Safaris tour guide who will transfer you to Phelwana Game Lodge.

Check in to your luxury tent or bush villa and enjoy afternoon snacks and drinks before you meet with your ranger for your first safari drive in the Phelwana Private Game Reserve. During this drive, you can expect to see giraffe, buffalo, zebra, wildebeest and impala to name but a few.

Return to camp after sunset, freshen up and enjoy a freshly prepared dinner under the African night sky.

itineraries.title: Big 5 Manyeleti Game Drives
itineraries.content:
We depart early today for a morning game drive in the Manyeleti Private Game Reserve.

This 23,000-hectare private game reserve borders directly to the vast Kruger National Park, as well as the famous Sabi Sands and Timbavati Game Reserves. As such, you can be absolutely sure to only experience the best game viewing possible.

We return to the lodge at around 11am for lunch and to relax before our second safari starts at 3pm.

We will be back at camp at around 7pm and you will have the opportunity to freshen up before dinner is served.

itineraries.title: Panorama Route
itineraries.content:
After breakfast, depart with your guide on a guided tour of the Panorama Route, a winding road traversing the end of the impressive Drakensberg Mountain Range.

Highlights:

✓ God’s Window is a beautiful viewpoint on the edge of the mountain range.
✓ Lisbon Waterfalls and the Berlin Waterfalls are two beautiful falls with an interesting history.
✓ The Blyde River Canyon is the third largest canyon in the world and the biggest all-green canyon in the world.
✓ Bourke's Luck Potholes is where two rivers meet and a truly spectacular sight!

We will enjoy lunch in the lovely little tourist town of Graskop and we will return to camp before sunset.

itineraries.title: Kruger National Park Safari
itineraries.content:
The day starts early as you depart on safari in the world-famous Kruger National Park. The whole day is devoted to driving inside the Kruger Park with your private guide in your own private air-conditioned closed vehicle.

The globally famous Kruger National Park stands as the biggest game reserve in South Africa and ranks among the top attractions in the country. It's a wildlife haven unlike any other, providing enchanting surprises and boundless nature that captures the essence of Africa. This is the territory of baobabs, fever trees, knob thorns, marula, and mopane trees, where the Big Five and numerous other mammal and bird species can be found.

Enjoy breakfast and lunch at one of the many stopovers and return to camp as the sun sets over the African bush.

Arriving back at camp, freshen up and enjoy some more of the world famous South African wines while reminiscing about the day’s amazing sightings before dinner is served.

itineraries.title: Bush walk & Endangered Species Centre
itineraries.content:
Enjoy an optional morning bush walk before breakfast.

We check out after breakfast and make our way to the nearby endangered species center for a tour of the facility. The Hoedspruit Endangered Species Centre is a unique African wildlife facility focusing on conservation and the sustainability of rare, vulnerable and threatened species.

Afterwards you will be transported back to Hoedspruit airport for your flight to Johannesburg.

title.rendered: Highlights of Cape Town & Namibia Guided Safari

content.rendered:
Highlights of Cape Town & Namibia Guided Safari

Experience why Cape Town in South Africa and Namibia are two of the most scenic destinations in Southern Africa during this 12 Day privately guided luxury Africa safari. This safari combines luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality with incredible scenery and unforgettable experiences, while in the presence of your private tour guide and host.

Safari & Tour Overview

From $7265
/ Starting from / per person sharing

Experience why Cape Town and Namibia are two of the most scenic destinations in Southern Africa during this 12 Day privately guided Luxury Safari.

Cape Town is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.

In Namibia, explore the oldest, driest desert in the world and take time to listen to the silence and to your soul. Climb the highest sand dunes in the world. Descend to the floor of the deepest canyon in Africa. Visit a German-inspired town where ocean waves and sand dunes merge into one. Experience wildlife care and conservation in action.

This safari combines luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality with incredible scenery and unforgettable experiences, while in the presence of your private Jewel of Africa Safaris tour guide who will accompany you and share his experiences with you along the way.

*This tour can be customized as per your preferences.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 6 Days 5 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Cape Town & Cape Winelands
  • Kalahari Desert & Sossusvlei
  • Swakopmund
  • Walvis Bay
  • Lake Mburo NP

Included

  • All Transfers
  • Conservation Fees
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Private Guide and Vehicle

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  • Explore Cape Town, the Mother City
  • Ride up to the summit of Table Mountain by cable car
  • Experience fine wines and dining in the Cape Winelands
  • Explore the beautiful Cape Peninsula
  • Visit Cape Point where two oceans meet
  • Get up close to a resident penguin colony at Boulders Beach
  • Direct flight from Cape Town to Walvis Bay, Namibia
  • Experience German hospitality in Swakopmund
  • Visit the iconic Sossusvlei and Dead Vlei in the Namib Desert
  • Learn more about wildlife rehabilitation in Namibia
  • Meet the owner of Na’ankuse Wildlife Sanctuary

Map & Destinations

Cape Town, South Africa
Swakopmund, Namibia
Sossusvlei, Namibia
Windhoek, Namibia

Cape Town

Cape Town, nicknamed the Mother City, is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.

Sossusvlei

The salt pan of Sossusvlei in Namibia is located in the middle of the Namib-Naukluft National Park in the area of the central Namib dunes. The Sossusvlei in Namibia is more than 300 kilometers long and 140 kilometers wide and consists of seemingly endless sand dunes. The meaning of the Nama word for the Namib translates to “empty space” or “place where there is nothing”. The spectacular height of these dunes creates a phenomenal attraction to visitors. These dunes can reach up to 300 meters high and look like an amphitheater surrounding the huge salt pan or “vlei”.

Swakopmund

Sandwiched between the Atlantic Ocean and the Namib Desert on the western coast, Swakopmund is one of those top travelers stops along the African road. This is Namibia's adventure capital and a surreal colonial remnant and is also the ideal place to start your exploration of the Skeleton Coast and Namib Desert. This is a city with as much personality as it has sea frontage and it retains a strong German flavour – from its cobbled streets and picturesque buildings to typical German restaurants and pubs serving German cuisine. This is also one of the much cooler destinations in Namibia, with its moist sea air, mist and rain sometimes surprising you in the Desert.

Windhoek

Windhoek is Namibia's capital and largest city. It is in the geographic centre of the country at an elevation of 1,600m. This is the city where most safaris travelling through Namibia begin, and also the first point of entry in Namibia should you arrive by airplane. Windhoek is the social, economic, political, and cultural center of the country. Nearly every Namibian national enterprise, governmental body, educational and cultural institution is headquartered here.

description:
Experience why Cape Town and Namibia are two of the most scenic destinations in Southern Africa during this 12 Day privately guided Luxury Safari.

Cape Town is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.

In Namibia, explore the oldest, driest desert in the world and take time to listen to the silence and to your soul. Climb the highest sand dunes in the world. Descend to the floor of the deepest canyon in Africa. Visit a German-inspired town where ocean waves and sand dunes merge into one. Experience wildlife care and conservation in action.

This safari combines luxury accommodation, high levels of service and hospitality with incredible scenery and unforgettable experiences, while in the presence of your private Jewel of Africa Safaris tour guide who will accompany you and share his experiences with you along the way.

*This tour can be customized as per your preferences.

Safari Summary

Tour Duration: 6 Days 5 Nights

Departure/Return Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

Destinations on Tour

  • Cape Town & Cape Winelands
  • Kalahari Desert & Sossusvlei
  • Swakopmund
  • Walvis Bay
  • Lake Mburo NP

Included

  • All Transfers
  • Conservation Fees
  • Luxury Accommodation
  • Meals
  • Private Guide and Vehicle

Highlights & Activities

During your safari you can look forward to the following highlights, activities and experiences to ensure an unforgettable time spent in Africa.

  • Explore Cape Town, the Mother City
  • Ride up to the summit of Table Mountain by cable car
  • Experience fine wines and dining in the Cape Winelands
  • Explore the beautiful Cape Peninsula
  • Visit Cape Point where two oceans meet
  • Get up close to a resident penguin colony at Boulders Beach
  • Direct flight from Cape Town to Walvis Bay, Namibia
  • Experience German hospitality in Swakopmund
  • Visit the iconic Sossusvlei and Dead Vlei in the Namib Desert
  • Learn more about wildlife rehabilitation in Namibia
  • Meet the owner of Na’ankuse Wildlife Sanctuary

Map & Destinations

[SBMAP ID="16"]

Cape Town

Cape Town, nicknamed the Mother City, is arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world offering an all-in-one adventure with beautiful beaches, breath-taking landscapes, award-winning wineries and mouth-watering cuisine. Here you’ll also find the renowned Table Mountain, one of the newly proclaimed natural wonders of the world.
